reviews.text: Park rangers were great, very informative. This place is nothing like I have seen before. Great history. While park is free the ferry ride to get there is not cheap. $76 for family of 4 (2 military).

Add Ft Sumter to your to do list when you visit Charleston! So much American History! Take the ferry from downtown Liberty Square . $24 for seniors and includes visit to the Fort as well as the boat ride. Total trip two hours. National Park Service rangers Andy and Gabby were wonderful narrators of this important time in American history.  We thoroughly enjoyed this experience.

The free bus to get to the memorial was perfect. Getting tickets was smooth and simple. The ferry ride was fun we got to see lots of things on the way and dolphins which is always a plus. The Rangers were phenomenal they made the trip so informative and fun. This is one of my highlights of my vacation

The cost for an adult including the ferry ride in 2019 is $23. The ferry is nice and features a snack bar and some history about the bay. The fort was damaged during the beginning of the civil war and little remains of the original structure, there are no original buildings or structures, just walls and a few cannons. The museum is well presented and if you are the last tour the you will have the opportunity to see the lowering of the flag.
Absolutely beautiful tour and monument, the guides were very informative! This was on our Charleston bucket list and definitely didn't disappoint. If you enjoy history this is a must see!!

This market was unique and very cute to all through. I feel like they have too many homemade weaves basket vendors (in my opinion there could be other, different shops in place). The Shea Butter store was really cool, I enjoyed learning the history and origin of the Shea Butter that was imported from Africa. It’s nice seeing the product in its raw form rather than in a bottle in a store aisle. Very cool!

The Market is on our list every time we visit Charleston. It's bustling and right in the center of historic downtown. Tons of vendors offer a wide variety of local products and the food options are great. Our go-to Market snack are Callie's Hot Little Biscuits, which are out of this world. I love that there is a clean public restroom inside.

Bring your walking shoes and experience local artisans, bakers, woodworkers --and merchandise resellers! Sift from booth to booth to discover some real local crafting. Many resellers offer the same merchandise priced at outrageously different prices. So if you see something you thought you'd never see again at a fair price, keep walking... You'll probably find it for half its price a few booths from there. This market sits at the heart of historical Charleston, and you can walk to rainbow row, the Battery and other key free attractions within minutes. Convenient public bathrooms are located at this market.

A plethora of quality hand crafted creations. The sea grass baskets are well made and many designs available.
 Beautiful paintings are reasonably priced. Sterling jewelry selections are abundant.

The place is very busy but it's a tourist attraction, lots and lots of history good to know and learn. The sights are beautiful the water is too. It is very family oriented, lots of things to see and do, everyone is nice! Kinda pricey but it's an attraction so don't expect to be cheap but you can enjoy the place and learn too

If you are in town you should come through in visit the citadel. This is a beautiful  College. The helicopter is huge you must see it in  Person. You can enter any time of day it is open to the public. The class ring is huge you must take a picture next to it. Beautiful place to be.

Clean cut at its best.

Given the shenanigans going on at most college campuses today, it was nice to see respect and professionalism on display everywhere. No ragged and torn clothing, no Rand McNally maps running up and down arms (tattoos) no steel dangling from noses, no pants hanging half off butts, one could feel pride in America and hope for the future when touring this vast and beautiful campus.

A quick tour showed this to be a non-nonsense, education first, institution. Having been in the military, it did not take me long to figure out that the "fast walkers" were freshmen. They stuck to their designated walkways, off the sidewalks for the most part, walking at a fast clip with a pronounced gait, and making sharp right turns at the corners. 

We would go back in a heartbeat and you should too when you start to lose faith in America. Different uniforms but it reminded me a lot of Annapolis. God bless the USA.
The Citadel is such an impressive place, the buildings the grounds, not to mention the overall purpose. Not only a proud moment for a mother but as citizen as well. ❤ 🇺🇸
It's unlike any other school I've been to
Most beautiful campus in all the South. Students here have chosen The Path Less Traveled and their journey is full of PRICELESS MEMORIES
Loved bringing my class here for a field trip. The scavenger hunt was fun and challenging but not too difficult. And they enjoyed guessing the artifacts.

Its a great place to go walking around, explore and I love the history around all te places. Now what's really a plus there's all kind of Great  places to stop off and get a bite. Its fun to take a tour but walking you are at your own pace. Try it both ways!!
Fantastic collection of Charleston history. Geared for adults and older kids. Self guided and interactive.
Great exhibits.
Loved being back, beautiful old houses, coble stone., and rich with history..
The museum is packed with information.  The layout is user friendly with voice tapes describing the scenes.  The museum is well staffed.  The gift shop is very small, however.
Took the ferry to Ft Sumpter from Liberty Square. What a great experience! I leaned many things about the history of Charleston on this quick trip.
Very much enjoyed everything about this place and the entire area... It's the south and it is filled with good people and good food... Cheers!
A nice park area to wait for the ferry. It's air conditioned inside and has public restrooms.
The ferry cruise and fort Sumter trip is great.

A majestic park filled with lovely overhanging trees, awe-inspiring views of the harbor, and a relaxing trail for walking. There are many great spots to relax and read. And of course, you can't miss the iconic pineapple fountain. Just a wonderful time.

This area is the perfect spot to bring your family for outdoor activities. We enjoyed a picnic on the grass overlooking the water and the kids ran around playing chase after. We flew our drone for awhile and got some gorgeous footage. Lots of beautiful scenery and on weekends break dancers and musical  artists can be found performing. Definitely recommend for some family fun.

The fountain is spectacular. It's nice and easy going. Not much else to do but it's not far from downtown. It would be great to have a botanical garden or planetarium at the park that served cocktails, but I'm just dreaming here.

Waterfront Park was the perfect spot to hang out while our family waited for our reservation time at Fleet Landing.  Lots of space for our kids to run and play and for us to rest in the sun.  Had it been warmer, they would have really enjoyed wading in the fountain.  We made sure to get a family picture in front of the pineapple fountain, too.  Be sure to stop here along your family's travels, too!

This is such a great place for a romantic walk on the water. There is a nice pier with picnic tables for a great lunch or early dinner. The famous Pineapple Fountain is here. There are several fountains for kids to run around in during the hot summers. It's a great place to visit and definitely worth taking the time to see.

This is a beautiful place to take your children to see beautiful artwork. Even a beautiful place to take your significant other. This was a field trip event to this Museum. It was a wonderful experience and Miss Elise had great patience and she was an awesome tour guide. She kept the attention of the children and interacted with them. Even the staff was wonderful very helpful, all the way to the security officer very kind-hearted people.

One of the highlights of our trip. Such a gorgeous space and loved the way it was designed to cut down on the noise of the lobby. We enjoyed the artists in the studios working that were beyond friendly and personable about their work.

Great exhibits and pieces, plenty of colonial and South Carolinian pieces. Would highly recommend.
Really nice experience with a mix of art from Gullah pieces to antique furniture to featured American artists. There's a unique miniature gallery that held drawers of broach-style pictures.

Stellar exhibits, beautiful building, and excellent staff.  A friend and I decided to go to here for an afternoon, and found the entire experience to be very pleasurable. I greatly enjoyed A Dark Place Of Dreams! Beautiful and moving!
Have been a member for two years. Beautiful building, excellent art works. Great miniature portraits and early colonial period pieces. Nice cafe and gift shop. Support your local art museums!
A most interesting place of worship.
Great historical tour!
A neighborly congregation
Beautiful area of Charleston.  Greeted by volunteers that were so nice and offered a great historic perspective.
Very welcoming congregation and just like a family reunion every Sunday. Rev Bryant is an awesome minister!!

...beautiful sermon and music rooted in the traditions of great theologians and composers while also respecting the thoughtful that is new.
...gently-friendly congregation, too : )
A surprisingly non-judgmental church that does a lot of loving Mission work. Solid, scripture based teaching and the music is fantastic. Friendly folks, too.
Great place for meetings
Went to a DAR meeting.
Got kicked out

I took the tour of this beautiful and historic house of worship. The staff was wonderful and took time to explain items. Not being of the faith I was nonetheless treated graciously. This is an important synagogue in the USA. It's beauty is surpassed only by the wonderful people. Charleston had some historic churches and I hope to tour more of them during this trip.

We received a wonderful tour of the synagogue and history of Charleston. The synagogue is the first Reformed Jewish Synagogue. The story of how that came to pass is quite interesting. The organization is among the five oldest synagogues in the US. There is a museum and a Judacia store. Definitely worth seeing!
Great historic site. Oldest operable synagogue in the US.
These people celebrate holidays with LAMB DINNERS! So, I got me one of those funny little hats and showed up. What a wonderful experience...not so much for the LAMBS.
A very spiritual place to be, for a memorable event like Bar Mitzvah.

Beautiful and reverent Mass celebrated in this historical Catholic Church in the heart of town. Friendly religious and parishioners will welcome you!Lovely Sunday Mass, at one of Charleston's oldest churches. Impressive frescoes adorn the ceiling of this church. A real gem for both Catholics and history lovers! You will appreciate its old fashioned pews, altar rails and stained glass windows. At the heart of historical Charleston and within walking distance to every popular attraction.

Amazing church!
Had a family wedding there!
Youngest son got married in this church back in May 2018 . Absolutely beautiful venue for a small wedding in beautiful downtown Charleston SC
Beautiful church
Such a beautiful church to visit— happy to have a church in walking distance for Sunday

The church is gorgeous and the congregation is very very kind. Greta, the church's wedding coordinator, is extremely professional and *really* knows what she is doing! I'm disappointed to leave a less  than stellar review for a church,  however the minister - Cress Darwin - seems to have his head in the clouds and really drags the place down.

My (now) wife and I started attending in the summer of 2018, and discovered Cress was "on a summer break" and there were guest ministers filling his place. I had just proposed to my wife, and we were looking for a place for our ceremony and 2NDPC seemed to fit the bill. After Cress got back, we watched one or two of his sermons before we signed the paperwork, but gradually became more disenchanted with him.

When it came time for our first marriage counseling, he tried swapping our meeting time on us by email just an hour before we were scheduled to meet, and we had already made the drive downtown. He didn't wait for confirmation that the new time would work for us, he just didn't show. When he finally arrived, he seemed to have no idea who we were, despite having previously talked with him numerous times by name, and had no idea what we were there for. When he finally got settled, his excuse for being late was that he was "out at the stables riding horses with his daughter since she is home from boarding school." None of that seemed very minister-ly to us. The marriage counseling itself was very aggressive, and was not conducive to communication as he continued to make not-so-subtle hints as to how much money he and his family had/came from (apparently his daughters are "sick of Paris" because they've been there so many times already). 

When the 1 month mark hit for us to get married, we got a surprise email from Cress stating he was bailing on our wedding, and had arranged for a replacement for us. We were initially caught off guard, but eventually got over it and wound up liking the stand-in more than Cress, so it was a blessing in disguise.

I'm not sure if he blew us off because our attendance began to wane as time went on - a direct product of my work schedule with the Navy being very inflexible and covering over service hours. Overall, we never established the kind of connection we were hoping to over the 6ish months we attended before our wedding.
Was not able to go inside or attend a service but the graveyard was open and was very beautiful and peaceful. The adjacent park is a nice shady spot to rest.
A lovely, welcoming house of God.

The Second Presbyterian Church in downtown Charleston is a historic site in the wraggbrough neighborhood. Reverend Cress Darwin is a excellent example of a true Charlestonion. Very active in the community
Wonderful place for weddings. And they have great church services on Sunday's
This is a beautiful piece of architecture and there is a historic graveyard behind it.
Historic German Lutheran,beautiful leaded glass windows,chandeliers,2nd level with real organ. Services support GRACE "Sola Gratia" FAITH "Sola Fenia" Absolute SCRIPTURE "Sola SCRIPTURA"
National Church Music Conference... Great event through Friday.
Very beautiful church and nice people. I went there for their annual Oktoberfest. Great food too.
Beautiful church. Friendly people. Parking garage right next to the church.
Visit in the evening and look at the magnificent stained glass windows...beautiful!   Loved the black and white tile contrasted with the red doors!
Lovely church both inside and out with the most friendly people. Traditional service and beautiful inside.
A warm and welcoming congregation.  The choir is unbelievably awesome!  Pr. Butler is wonderful in imparting the Word of GOD and the Bible in such a way that it makes sense in our lives today.
Cemetery was not opened sign said till 2 p.m but it was close we got there at 1pm

The moment my husband and I walked through the doors we knew we had found our church home. St.Johns has everything. A rich history, beautiful place to worship, warm and friendly congregation and an amazing Pastor. We feel very blessed to be a part of this wonderful church family!

A warm, friendly, inviting, place to worship in the Charleston area.  It has a traditional Lutheran service with a pastor who delivers a very captivating sermon well worth your time.  I strongly recommend St. Johns whether you are a visitor in Charleston or a life long resident.
Great bar food. The Billy Fries are freaking awesome. Friendly and efficient wait staff. Always a very busy place, so kinda loud. But I'll definitely go back a fourth time.
Awesome place. Great food. Friendly people. Nice atmosphere. Would recommend to anyone. Will definitely go back.

We waited 1 hour and 45 minutes for our food. When it got here, the salad was warm and wilted. There are 3 cherry tomatoes, 4 thin, bruised cucumbers, a small handful of wilted lettuce and a large amount of chewy, old chicken in the container. I can not even express how disappointed I am. This salad isn't worth the $10. I will NEVER order from them again.

First way overpriced and hyped. Tried it a second time, love it. Then I tried it again a third time well TRIED by delivery but turns out the driver stopped at 11 but on your website it says  delivery stops at midnight, so you know false advertising or some form of miscommunication
Sam made my experience great at the bar.  She was very attentive and quick with service.  Thank you for this great experience.  My food came out quick and hot.

Had a fabulous lunch at Sticky Fingers! Shared the sweet potato casserole side dish, along with the dry rubbed chicken wings. They have a decent beer selection too. Service was fabulous. Reasonable prices, relaxed atmosphere. Check them out when you are in Charleston!

We chose this restaurant based on the testimonials in the window from Stephen Colbert and President George W. Bush. The restaurant seemed understaffed: there was a wait to be seated in the less-than-half-full dining room because much of the time there was no one at the door to greet new arrivals. Food also took a while to come out and some was only somewhat warm when it did arrive. The pulled pork sandwich wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing, either. We didn't see our server (or any staff) often, but he was unfailingly polite and attentive when he did appear.
Fixing the staffing issues and getting food out of the kitchen more quickly (and hotter/fresher) would earn another star on my review.

Our favorite things to order here are the pulled pork nachos or the loaded pork potato skins... I gave them a 4 star because the food is not always prepared correctly...one visit it will be perfect the next visit not so much...they need to work on getting it delicious consistently.
Seemed like they could use a little more help, but the food was amazing! Our waiter was very nice. Cool place for a lunch stop! Edited to add, their Gluten Free menu is fabulous!

We recently visited this establishment and were very impressed. The staff is very accommodating, detailed and exceptional. They served 48 kids and 20 adults in an hour. The food came out both hot and delicious. We really enjoyed this dining experience.

I recently went here with my wife and kids. I had a great time. Our server Beth was really fantastic and did everything we asked. The wings and fried mushrooms are great. 5/5 would recommend going here with family or friends! 👍🏻😊

Beth L made our experience wonderful. She was very attentive and our drinks were always full. My daughter was not in the best mood and she chatted with her and sincerely tried to help. We will definitely be back and will ask for her by name! Every restaurant should have such great service. The food was also great, but the service is what made the night.

Wild wings cafe was the bomb. My waitress Cameron what great. She handle my table very well good job!!!  The live music is amazing an the environment is just great. Whats not to like about it!  Thank u again cam for the great hospitality. Definitely coming back!!!

Beth is a great server who will make sure you’re taken care of! She’s super sweet and wants to make sure her customers have a great experience. I recommend sitting in her section next time you stop by Wild Wing!

The server was fantastic. She was prompt in getting our orders and refilling our drinks. The food though was not hot, like it’s been sitting waiting to be picked up too long. I ordered wings with hot buffalo but it tasted very mild. They were still good and I’ll be back.

Went back for brunch. The shrimp and grits were good. The mimosas had more champagne than juice, which is awesome! The hostess was just as nice and friendly as the last time I was there. They also had a guy singing and playing the piano which I thought was a nice touch. Will be back!

From the time we walked in till the time we left the service and hospitality were top notch. The food was delicious and fresh. Our server, Melissa, was so friendly and knowledgeable not only of the menu but also of the hotel. Kudos to the chef and to MGMT. we will definitely be back.

Came to the Barbadoes Room for our first for Valentines Day. The food and service was top notch. The staff was very attentive, along with the hostess and Maitre’D (I’m horrible with names please excuse me) our server was AJ, kudos to him.. he did a fantastic job. All of our expectations were met. Highly recommend this place!

So, we went for Restaurant Week and the food was really, very good. My friend tried the oysters on a half shell and I had the she crab soup. He was quite impressed with his oysters and other than wanting a little more sherry in my soup, I was pleased as well. For the main course, I tried the short ribs over collards with fingerling potatoes. Umm umm good! He went with the fresh catch which was wreck fish. Had a little kick to it he said. We both cleaned our plates. The choice dessert was a cinnamon cheesecake. It was so cute and small, almost delicate looking. But that first bite was like wow! I ate every last bit. Every. Last. Bit. It was our first time, but I'll definitely be returning soon. By the way, I hear they have a killer brunch too.
Great place to eat, lots if history in the building. Food was delicious, service was above and beyond.

I travelled by train for 3.5 hours to celebrate my sister's birthday at this restaurant. It was worth the journey there and back to sit and partake of the fine, fun food and wine for lunch. We were well attended by staff and owner. We had two toddlers with us, and two lovely mother, making a party of 6. The views were spectacular. Thank you for making this day for my sister memorable.

The views,  I never get tired of them. The Cast Bar venue is just the nicest place on the Central Coast of NSW to meet up with friends and family. The waitstaff are all very friendly, Jordan made up a lovely jug of the days cocktail for us, and kept us supplied with ice and water to battle the heat. Logan had done a fantastic job in building the business as both great restaurant and fab wine/cocktail bar. The food has a wide range from share plates through to pizza and lovely fresh pasta and seafood dishes. Something for everyone, even the kids.

This is a great venue for a special occasion or birthday celebration. I was here for a farewell party and the food was delicious. It is not a budget friendly menu, but the food has generous helpings and the drinks have creative attention to detail with their presentation. Staff were very friendly and the environment was relaxed and atmospheric. The view of the water made for a pleasant lunchtime outing with a feeling of luxury and solitude despite being only a few minutes walk to the main street. Definitely coming here again. I ordered the pork cutlet, it was a difficult choice between this and the swordfish. The staff mentioned that both were popular choices.

Even though they were vert busy at lunch on a Sunday - waiting time for food to be served was a reasonable time. Good quality food - at a decent price.
The location was perfect! Lovely view overlooking the water on near perfect warm Autumn day!

Has good street appeal with limited parking out front. It's open and airy with lots of staff to great you . Good outdoor deck and water views . Menu is basic such as steaks, burgers, pasta and salads.  My seafood linguine was under cooked and seafood looked like it was from frozen and lacked flavor. My wife had a thai beef salad which was nice with tender lean med rare slices.
Overall the value was a little under the price tag at over $30 each . The place is starting to look a little dated and could use some basic maintenance especially on the entrances and there appears to be no disabled ramps.

We had a wonderful dining experience here with friends during a long weekend trip to Charleston. The service was exemplary. The wait staff had a thorough knowledge of the menu, answered all questions we had with clarity and patience. Food was prepared very well. Enjoyed the entire experience. Would definitely return. Make sure you get reservations though.

While it can be a little tough to get in, it is definitely worth it. We dined at the bar, and the bartender was incredible! She was friendly, engaging, knowledgeable, and very good with recommendations. The food was unique and exquisitely prepared. The ambience is also delightful - it looks great and feels comfortable. Highly recommend.

Excellent experience at Fig! Came early for our reservation but got seated right away. Gnocchi as an appetizer was fluffy and delightful. The fish stew has such an amazing, vibrant flavor and the fish was perfectly cooked. Great atmosphere at the restaurant, mostly decided by them playing Lake Street Dive the whole time.

Colleagues booked this restaurant so wasn't sure what to expect, however when I arrived I was very pleasantly surprised. The place is reasonably sized and has a great ambience about it. The menu was varied and the food was delicious (particularly the side dish of broccoli with garlic - yum). The service was really good too. The whole experience more than met my expectations and I would definitely visit here again.

Sat at the bar at 5pm without a reservation and had great service with wonderful food.  Ricotta gnocchi appetizer was tremendous.  Grouper had great fresh flavor.  Steak was amazing and the potato puree was to die for.  Worth every penny!

Oh my goodness!!! Loved this place! There was a two hour wait for a table but if the bar seats or communal table opens up, it's first come first serve. We waited maybe 5min before we grabbed two seats at the communal table. We were SO glad we waited. The food was amazing! We ordered the grilled swordfish and the bouillabaisse. Both excellent!! Well worth the higher price tag.

Beautiful restaurant and very friendly staff but the star is the food. Crab cakes are a must try. Still dreaming about them! Scallops with ginger grapefruit sauce was also great as was the halibut over risotto. Key lime pie was a delicious and light finish. Our server Matt was fantastic and offered great advice on food options and wine pairing as well. Thx for such a great memory.

Described as the best seafood in town, Hank's doesn't disappoint. The staff was wonderful and provided great insight. The pineapple ginger margarita was maybe the best cocktail I've ever had. The crab leg special was indeed special and the fried muscles we're excellent. I'd definitely come back here.

Wonderful restaurant for small or large groups.  Great selection of fresh seafood.  Seafood castle highly recommended!  Great service and waitress was knowledgeable and courteous.  Had the #5 broiled scallops, shrimp and flounder and was just amazing!  Highly recommended this restaurant 👍🤩

We had the best service at the bar - the bartender was AMAZING! The food was also spectacular. The lobster dish is decadently generous, and I thoroughly enjoyed the high quality and freshness of their à la carte seafood. The ambiance is classy without feeling stuffy. Highly recommend!

This was an amazing meal. So comforting and delicious. It was good service and not too busy. I had the pimento cheese sandwich and you really get your money’s worth. It was ginormous and so good. If I come back to Charleston, I will eat here again.

Let me start by saying, the food here was excellent.  It was prepared properly and it tasted very good.  The only reason I gave it 3 stars, was the price.  Their prices are outrageous for the type of restaurant this is.  Very Mom & Pop, very country casual feel, which is fine but, $35.00 for dinner for ONE person (including tax and tip) for a one chicken breast fillet over rice with gravy poured over it and two sides, mixed greens and fried corn on the cob.  In addition, I had iced tea and a slice of banana cream pie for dessert.  THAT'S IT!  (They do serve everyone a little bowl of cucumbers/onions in vinegar when you sit down, ....it's kinda' a southern thing.)

The service was good, no complaints except the HUGE price.  If money is no object, go for it, ....it was delicious!
High quality food but lacks some flavor. Some of the best pricing for downtown Charleston.  Best price for quality during our 5 day trip. Family friendly.
Nice place to eat. The food was delicious. Would definitely eat here again. The service was friendly and prompt. Did not once see the bottom of my glass. (I'm a simple man😉)
Great food!! Great service! Great seating.. I had the fried flounder collard greens and mac and cheese and topped it off with pecan pie. Worth every calorie.

This restaurant is great; great atmosphere, great service, great food! I had a great experience for my birthday. I definitely recommend 82 Queen! It is a bit pricey, but considering it is historic, downtown, and awesome food with bigger portions than similar quality places, it is well worth the price... pretty reasonable, actually.

Best she crab soup in Charleston! If I have a bad day or need a pick me up, I come straight to 82 Queen for my favorite soup! They also have the best seafood in my opinion. What a great place for the entire family!
Fantastic spot. Historic area with great food and ambience. Crab Benedict was the bomb for brunch and paired well with a mimosa. Definitely worth a visit.
This place is unreal good.  Every element is excellent. They treat you so well and I can't recall a better meal.
Very nice, had lunch in the courtyard. Very southern atmosphere. I had the bbq shrimp and grits. Very good. A little on the pricey side but worth it.

Food is really delicious, personnel if funny. 'If you don't take the chicken, you'll be judged'. Must say the chicken was good. So was the pork belly, the green tomatoes, and all the rest. We shared starters for the whole table of 8, so we could have a taste of many. 
I'd go here again, again and again...

Food should not be warm/cool. They should cook less food more often and not big batches at one time. I had the greens and fried chicken. I ordered and the food came out in like 2 minutes ?? Greens were ok but chicken and mac and cheese definitely reheated in the microwave... They can do better, this is a popular place I hope they don't get complacent.
The fried green tomatoes are some of the best I’ve ever had. Buttermilk fried chicken was crisp and juicy. Served with collard greens, mashed potatoes and a biscuit. Can’t go wrong!

Husband and I dined here. It was pretty good. I have no complaints.The food was pretty good the atmosphere pretty good - but nothing outstanding to be honest. We would probably not go back just because there ARE outstanding places to eat in Charleston in this price range.
Excellent fare in a attractive setting.  Enticing menu items.  First class service.  Prices comparable to other high end venues. A go- to place in Charleston!

I actually went there two times during my stay in Baton Rouge. Once with a large group from work and once with just one other person. It was a great place for a large group (you probably need a reservation). Great food and great service.

The second time I ate outside and watched to sun set over the Mississippi. Beautiful.

Beautiful, upscale sushi in a fantastic location! The food is always wonderful & the bar is amazing. The rooftop patio is easily the best feature, with ample seating & a wonderful view of the river and downtown. Service can be hit or miss, though, and if there are events going on downtown parking can be hard to come by.

Really nice restaurant. Food was very fresh and very good! Probably the best meso soup I have had to date. The view was also nice. They are located on the sixth floor so you are looking out over the Mississippi River. When I was there, there was such a dense fog you couldn't see the water but it was actually very cool to be above the fog and look out over the water.

Overlooking the Mississippi river and downtown Baton Rouge is a great place for a restaurant but, add sushi and it becomes an outstanding restaurant! Our first visit here was such an amazing experience. The manager and waitstaff were absolutely top notch. I cannot fully express how great they are. 
We had sushi and shrimp and grits. My girlfriend, the sushi expert, said everything was fresh and delicious. I like that the menu has other items besides sushi and the drinks menu is tremendous. We can't wait to come back so we can sit outside and eat. 😁
Awesome place with a super nice view to the Mississippi river. Great during afternoon when sun is going down. Food is very good.
